{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acromegaly is a condition characterized by an excess of growth hormone, usually due to a pituitary adenoma. This leads to various manifestations including changes in facial features. One of these changes is mandibular prognathism, which is an abnormal forward projection of the lower jaw. This condition is associated with Class III malocclusion, where the lower jaw protrudes or juts forward, causing the lower teeth to overlap the upper teeth.", "answer_choice": "D. Class. III malocclusion"}
